title: Jeremy Pugh
text:
Jeremy David Pugh (born 4 March 1960) is a former international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player. He played for the <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Wales national rugby union team</a> in the late 1980s.
Pugh played his club rugby for <a href="Neath%20RFC">Neath</a>. He first played for Wales in 1987 against the USA. Altogether he won three <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">caps</a>. He played his last international match against <a href="Scotland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Scotland</a> on 3 March 1990.
In 2006 Pugh was one of three former international rugby players to climb <a href="Mount%20Kilimanjaro">Mount Kilimanjaro</a> to raise money for the <a href="NSPCC">NSPCC</a>. Pugh later became a property developer in <a href="Builth%20Wells">Builth Wells</a> and, in May 2017, was elected to <a href="Powys%20County%20Council">Powys County Council</a> as an independent councillor for the town.
